page.title: 05TYDD ST. GILES - DRAINAGE
page.content: The Fens were always marshy.In winter the rivers overflowed so drains were badly needed.The fens were divided into The North Level, The Middle Level and the South Level.They are called the Bedford Levels.The North Level Main Drain flows through our parish. It was dug in 1834: it is 23 metres wide and was dug by hand using wheelbarrows,not modern machinery. There was a large army of workers, mostly from Ireland.They lived in camps,and the village must have seen much excitement while they were here. The Drain cut across roads.It is this drain which carries the water from most of the fens in the north of this county,as well as those in parts of Lincolnshire,safely to the sea.
